content.rendered:
Photo by New Old Stock

Hello Genesis enthusiasts.

This week is a busy week for This Week in Genesis because Genesis 2.2 is here and I’ve got a round-up just for you.

But the fun doesn’t stop there (oh no).

There’s also the big news that Lauren Gaige over at Restored 316 has launched a new feminine WordPress theme marketplace called Pink & Press (more details on that below).

Plus, if that wasn’t enough, there’s a free new theme from Rafal Tomal, some fantastic work in the showcase, and a new Genesis plugin just for you from the Cre8tiveDiva.

Enjoy.

Genesis 2.2 lift-off!!1!

I guess Genesis 2.2 is available now — http://t.co/1wQv0eqiBS #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/xvfdFVHqum

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) September 2, 2015

That’s right Calvin, Genesis 2.2 is here. Which means lots of shiny new things, including accessibility improvements, some sexy code tweaks and an all new favicon uploader (no more messing about with FTP).

First up on those accessibility improvements, Rian Rietveld has a great summary of the accessibility changes you’ll find in Genesis 2.2, plus, she also some advice on those that want to remove extra headings that you may see in your theme as part of the 2.2. changes.

#genesiswp devs: If you want remove extra headings in Genesis 2.2, don’t use remove_action, but hide them with CSS http://t.co/gCPGDU2EPw

— Rian Rietveld (@RianRietveld) September 3, 2015

If you’re a theme developer you might also benefit from this article from Jesse Petersen on Two things you need to do to your Genesis 2.2 theme.

Two Things You Need to Do to Your #GenesisWP 2.2 Theme – Petersen Media Group http://t.co/7iFLXTJgWM #wordpress

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) September 3, 2015

Plus Jackie D’Elia has a suggestion for you if you’d prefer a slightly different style for your accessibility friendly underlined links.

Don't like underlining links for #a11y? try using border-bottom with dotted; – a softer visual cue #genesiswp

— Jackie D'Elia (@SavvyJackie) September 4, 2015

Inevitably, as with any big software release, there was a small bug (not security related). For most people it shouldn’t be an issue and can be fixed by installing the Genesis Accessible plugin or just waiting for Genesis 2.2.1 to be released, as leading Genesis developer Bill Erickson explains.

#genesiswp bug in 2.2, missing archive titles. Wait for 2.2.1, or install Genesis Accessible plugin to fix immediately

— Bill Erickson (@BillErickson) September 3, 2015

And finally, of course, big up to all the Genesis contributors who put in countless hours of hard work to Keep Genesis Awesome.

Congrats to my fellow female first-time contributors @dreamwhisper @RianRietveld & @robincornett! #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/Lt7FlMbdfD

— carrie dils (@cdils) September 3, 2015

New feminine WordPress theme marketplace – Pink & Press

If Genesis 2.2 launching wasn’t enough, Lauren Gaige over at Restored 316 also has some big news this week with the launch of new feminine WordPress theme marketplace: Pink & Press.

Introducing Pink & Press: A Feminine WordPress Theme Marketplace http://t.co/OQJyT9YIft #genesiswp #WordPress

— Lauren Gaige (@restored316) September 4, 2015

I’ve only had a quick look before publishing this but it looks pretty awesome and I know that if Lauren is behind it it’s going to be great so make sure you check it out.

Themes

If the excitement of 2.2 wasn’t enough this week also sees some exciting theme news.

First up, the new Genesis sample theme for all you developers and hackers (the good kind) out there.

You can download new Genesis Sample theme from here – http://t.co/YkEhTaAvEK #genesiswp #WordPress

— Davinder Singh (@idavinder) September 3, 2015

But just as exciting is this stunning (and completely free) Genesis child theme from Rafal Tomal entitled Journal.

Get my new free Genesis child theme – http://t.co/8Rh8y2Am2L #genesiswp

— Rafal Tomal (@RafalTomal) September 3, 2015

Next up, that man Brian Gardner likes a theme tease and this week is no different with a sneak peak at Atmosphere Pro.

More theme teasing’ —> http://t.co/Mk2llXKyBF #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) August 31, 2015

Another theme tease, this time from Ryan Townley over at Minimal Genesis.

New #genesiswp theme is coming along nicely. Finishing touches, testing, documentation, then launch. Maybe Monday? #minimalism

— Minimal Genesis (@minimalgenesis) September 3, 2015

And finally, I had to include this little tweet from Genesis community legend Susan Ramsey who has revealed that she’s working on her first Genesis theme. 30 September can’t come soon enough 😉

putting it out here to keep myself accountable. I'm working on my first #GenesisWP theme. Release date of 9/30 #Elise25 @lindseyriel

— Susan Ramsey (@GraphDesigning) August 31, 2015

Showcase

First up in the showcase this week, the fantastic reallifedinner.com from regular showcase favourites Emily White and Greg Young (thanks to Brian Gardner for the tip).

Delicious dinner ideas & more on the recently redesigned http://t.co/XQEJzMfNve. Major props to @hbgreg for awesome development. #genesiswp

— Emily White (@emwhitedesigns) August 31, 2015

This week also saw the re-launch of the gorgeous new website for rainmakerplatform.com

We've completely redesigned http://t.co/RHHauDt9ts – check it out! #genesiswp

— Rafal Tomal (@RafalTomal) September 2, 2015

Great new site from Archer Creative for archerandcove.com

Excited to launch @archerandcove's website. Check out their awesome shirts (& order online now!) http://t.co/insE9P8OO2 #genesiswp

— Archer Creative (@Archer_Creative) September 1, 2015

Katie Price launches this elegant new site for edwardjohnphotography.com

My new favorite site design: http://t.co/Mdc5GUo3Gm (Based on Altitude Pro) #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/9cVZwycolx

— Katie Price (@KtPrice) September 1, 2015

Popular Genesis consultants and theme shop, Web Savvy Marketing, relaunch their website with a clean new design web-savvy-marketing.com

And we are live! Check out our new design based on #genesiswp. http://t.co/mOOLmHoe0d pic.twitter.com/4iHoJ3Dcuk

— Web Savvy Marketing (@WebSavvyMrkting) September 1, 2015

And finally…

Cre8tiveDiva launches a new Genesis Mobile Widgets plugin designed to offer new widget areas only shown to those browsing your website on smaller screens.

New Plugin! Increase Your Revenue with Genesis Mobile Widgets http://t.co/x5ZwgRHn06 #genesiswp #wordpress #bloggers #fbloggers #foodies

— Cre8tiveDiva (@TheCre8tiveDiva) August 31, 2015

That’s all for this week.

Tune in again soon for another exciting edition of This Week in Genesis.

Till then, stay awesome.

PS A huge congrats to the Genesis community’s own Sridhar Katakam for reaching $10,000 a month on his membership website. Go Srikat!

excerpt.rendered: This Week in Genesis sees the lift-off of Genesis 2.2, a new feminine WordPress theme marketplace from Lauren Gaige, plus a free theme from Rafal Tomal.
